item.title: Stop weak-strong dance
item.description:
Closures in Swift are extremely useful, they are interchangeable with functions and that creates a lot of opportunities for useful use-cases. One thing we have to be careful when using them is to avoid retain cycles.

We have to do it so often that it begs the question:

Can we improve the call-site API?

item.title: Writing Xcode plugin in Swift
item.description:
I’ve found myself using Xcode a lot more than I did in Objective-C.

One of things I’ve missed a lot from my AppCode setup, is the ability to jump to specific file & line that logged a console message.

Because Xcode doesn’t offer such functionality and because I do not like to complain, I’ve decided to write my own plugin for it.

I wrote it in Swift.

item.title: Stop writing data parsing code in your apps
item.description:
Data parsing is one of most common tasks we need to do in our apps, yet still majority of people do this parsing by hand, always repeating the same code for each class they need to map.

I’ll show show you how you could simplify your code and make it more readable at the same time.

item.title: Expanded use of asserts
item.description:
Do you use assertions in your code? What for? How do you handle release builds ?

There is a better way than NSAssert…

item.title: Pinch to reveal animation, like in Boeing Milestones
item.description:
Boeing made a nice app for iPad

I was shown this app and asked if it’s hard to do this pinch to reveal animation. It’s actually quite easy to do with CoreAnimation.

item.title: Drawing smooth lines with cocos2d ios inspired by Paper
item.description:
You’ve probably seen Paper, the app is pretty cool and the drawings look really nice and smooth.

I’m working on my personal app that needs something similar, and after doing some research I’ve not seen a proper solution.

So I wrote one.

item.title: Automatic removal of NSNotificationCenter or KVO observers
item.description:
Observer pattern is common on iOS platform, you use observers in NSNotificationCenter and in Key Value Observing.

You need to remember to unregister before you release your observer object, if you don’t you are going to have crashes.

What if you could automate it ?

item.title: Using UIGestureRecognizers in cocos2d
item.description:
cocos2d is one of the best gaming framework I’ve seen, but it doesn’t use UIKit.

When Apple introduced UIGestureRecognizers they unified how touch interaction should work.

Is there a way we can add UIGestureRecognizers to cocos2d architecture, without modyfing cocos2d source?
